page.title: 06GAMEKEEPING - EGMERE AREA
page.content: The area comprises parts of the Walsingham and Holkham Estates. It is {good shooting country.}Large fields of light, stony soil abound. There are small woods mainly of pine planted to screen the disused airfield living quarters. The game is almost all truly wild.{Pheasant red leg and grey {partridge}thrive under the care of {gamekeepers.}They control{predators such as stoats, weasels, rats and corvids. The fox is rarely seen here. {Partridges}are shot only when the weather has allowed chicks to survive in numbers above a balanced breeding stock.{Pheasants}are usually shot four times a year. An annual bag of 250 might be taken from this part of Wals- ingham Estate. The Holkham Estate is shot privately by the owners and their guests. Walsingham shooting is leased to G. Joyce Esq.
